title: The Boy Who Sailed To Spain
description: A searing indictment of today's Western World as seen through the eyes of a fifteen-year-old boy traveling alone in the Spain of 2015, on a life or death mission. His values forged in an archaic Christian setting yet colored by the Islamic cradle of his birth. His striving for the good while beset with evils today inherent in all Western society, sexual depravity, over-available pornography, drugs, racism, all of which he rejects and fights against. He is pursued in his quest by the organized forces of evil representing the heinous and insidious power of those giants of commerce, money, and power, and also by a blind authority which has taken its cue to pursue him from the lies of a bad woman.He is befriended by people from one of those oases of light springing up in the West to counter the negative, and with their help is able to continue on his road towards the light.
author: Paul O'Garra
